spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The aboleth's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The deva has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deva makes two attacks.

action.name: Celestial Hammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 17 ({@damage 5d6}) radiant damage. On a hit, the target can't make opportunityattacks against the deva until the beginning of the target's next turn.

bonus.name: Bonus
entries: Entries

reaction.name: Self-Sacrifice
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the thrall that the thrall can see hits an aboleth with an attack, the thrall can make itself the target of the attack instead.

legendary.name: Legendary action
entries: Entries for legendary action

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: When the jabberwock fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. It can't do so against an effect that would sever one of its body parts.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: The jabberwock can take three reactions per round. It can't take more than one reaction on the same turn.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The jabberwock regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. The jabberwock dies only if its head is severed. A creature can sever the jabberwock's head by dealing 15 slashing damage to it in a single turn while it has 0 hit points.

trait.name: Vorpal Weakness
entries: While the jabberwock is bloodied, a roll of 16 or higher with a sword with increased critical hit range is treated as a 20.

trait.name: Whiffling Flight
entries: The jabberwock's flight is clumsy and unpredictable. While the jabberwock is flying it has disadvantage on attack rolls and attack rolls against it have disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jabberwock attacks once with its bite and twice with its claw.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) slashing damage. On a critical hit against a creature, the jabberwock's teeth completely cripple a limb until the character completes a long rest or is restored to full hit points. At the DM's discretion, the target might suffer a permanent wound that requires the {@spell regeneration|LevelUp} spell. For a typical humanoid, roll {@dice 1d6}: 1-3 arm (preventing the use of that arm to hold items or wear a shield), 4-6 leg (halving the target's Speed).

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 21}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. The jabberwock can have up to two creatures {@condition grappled} at a time.

action.name: Eyes of Flame (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The jabberwock's gaze ignites everything in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area makes a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, taking 49 ({@damage 14d6}) fire damage on a failed save or half damage on a success.

bonus.name: Burble
entries: The jabberwock speaks in the magical Jabber language. Each creature within 30 feet of the jabberwock that can hear it and that doesn't speak Jabber makes a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is subjected to a burbling curse. While cursed, half the words the creature speaks are replaced with words in the Jabber language. Each time the creature speaks, casts a spell with a vocalised component, or uses an effect that requires listeners to understand its words, the creature must roll a {@dice d20}. On a roll of 1-9, the speech is unintelligible or the spell or effect is wasted. The creature repeats the saving throw whenever it finishes a long rest. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, it is immune to Burble for 24 hours.

reaction.name: Claws that Catch
entries: When a creature escapes the jabberwock's grapple, the jabberwock makes a claw attack against that creature.

reaction.name: Jaws that Bite
entries: When a creature that the jabberwock can see makes a melee attack against it, the jabberwock makes a bite attck against that creature.

reaction.name: Whiffling Dodge
entries: When the jabberwock would be hit by a ranged attack while it is not flying, it flies up to its speed, imposing disadvantage on the triggering attack.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: When the jabberwock fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. It can't do so against an effect that would sever one of its body parts.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: The jabberwock can take three reactions per round. It can't take more than one reaction on the same turn.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The jabberwock regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. The jabberwock dies only if its head is severed. A creature can sever the jabberwock's head by dealing 15 slashing damage to it in a single turn while it has 0 hit points.

trait.name: Vorpal Weakness
entries: While the jabberwock is bloodied, a roll of 16 or higher with a sword with increased critical hit range is treated as a 20.

trait.name: Whiffling Flight
entries: The jabberwock's flight is clumsy and unpredictable. While the jabberwock is flying it has disadvantage on attack rolls and attack rolls against it have disadvantage.

trait.name: Manxome Burble
entries: Creatures subject to Jabberwocky's Burbling Curse can spread the curse to those that hear them. Whenever a creature that was cursed by Jabberwocky speaks, each listener must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or be subject to Burbling Curse. A listener curse in this way can't spread the curse any further.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jabberwock attacks once with its bite and twice with its claw.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) slashing damage. On a critical hit against a creature, the jabberwock's teeth completely cripple a limb until the character completes a long rest or is restored to full hit points. At the DM's discretion, the target might suffer a permanent wound that requires the {@spell regeneration|LevelUp} spell. For a typical humanoid, roll {@dice 1d6}: 1-3 arm (preventing the use of that arm to hold items or wear a shield), 4-6 leg (halving the target's Speed).

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 21}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. The jabberwock can have up to two creatures {@condition grappled} at a time.

action.name: Eyes of Flame (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The jabberwock's gaze ignites everything in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area makes a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, taking 49 ({@damage 14d6}) fire damage on a failed save or half damage on a success.

bonus.name: Burble
entries: The jabberwock speaks in the magical Jabber language. Each creature within 30 feet of the jabberwock that can hear it and that doesn't speak Jabber makes a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is subjected to a burbling curse. While cursed, half the words the creature speaks are replaced with words in the Jabber language. Each time the creature speaks, casts a spell with a vocalised component, or uses an effect that requires listeners to understand its words, the creature must roll a {@dice d20}. On a roll of 1-9, the speech is unintelligible or the spell or effect is wasted. The creature repeats the saving throw whenever it finishes a long rest. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, it is immune to Burble for 24 hours.

reaction.name: Claws that Catch
entries: When a creature escapes the jabberwock's grapple, the jabberwock makes a claw attack against that creature.

reaction.name: Jaws that Bite
entries: When a creature that the jabberwock can see makes a melee attack against it, the jabberwock makes a bite attck against that creature.

reaction.name: Whiffling Dodge
entries: When the jabberwock would be hit by a ranged attack while it is not flying, it flies up to its speed, imposing disadvantage on the triggering attack.

reaction.name: Eyes of Vengeance
entries: When a creature within 60 feet targets Jabberwocky with a spell or magical effect, or includes Jabberwocky in the area of a spell or magical effect, Jabberwocky immediately recharges and uses Eye of Flame, including the attacker in its area if possible.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The fateholder's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 18}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The fateholder can see into both the Material and Ethereal Plane.

trait.name: Lawful
entries: The fateholder radiates a Lawful aura.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: When the fateholder fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does so, one of its eight eyes becomes dull. Roll {@dice d8} on the list of Eye Beam secondary effects. Targets automatically succeed on saving throws against that effect.

trait.name: Psionic Awareness
entries: When a creature within 1 mile of the fateholder uses a psionic ability, the fateholder knows the creature's direction but not its distance.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The fateholder can use its climb speed even on difficult surfaces and upside down on ceilings.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The fateholder ignores movement restrictions imposed by webs.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fateholder makes four claw attcks. It can replace any claw attack with an Eye Beam.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target {@condition grappled} by the fateholder. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it is infected with {@disease pastrasite|LevelUp|pastrasites} which first manifest during its next rest.

action.name: Eye Beam
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be subjected to one of the following randomly chosen secondary effects:

items.name: Alter Fate
entries: The target gains the {@condition doomed|LevelUp} condition. It is aware it will die as a result of a bizarre series of coincidences in 13 ({@dice 2d12}) hours. In addition to the normal means of removing the condition, it can be avoided if the fateholder dies or chooses to end it as an action. Alternatively, the fateholder can instead permanently replace the target's Destiny with one of the fateholder's choice. A character who has unlocked the fulfillment feature of their previous destiny is considered to have already unlocked that of their new destiny.

items.name: Cut Strand
entries: The target takes an additional 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points it dies, its body disappears, and creatures tht are more than 100 feet away when it dies forget about its existence until reminded. This effect can only be undone with {@spell wish|LevelUp} or {@spell true resurrection|LevelUp}.

items.name: Foreshadow
entries: The next hit on the target before the end of the fateholder's next turn is a critical hit.

items.name: Seal Spells
entries: The target can't cast spells or use psionic abilities until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Shift Reality
entries: The fateholder teleports the target to an unoccupied space within 120 feet of the fateholder. The space must be on a solid surface but the fateholder doesn't need to see it.

items.name: Tangle Psyches
entries: The target is {@condition confused|LevelUp} until the end of its next turn as several alternate versions of itself vie for mental control.

items.name: Terrify
entries: The target is {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. While {@condition frightened} in this way, its Speed is 0.

items.name: Twist History
entries: The fateholder alters a Large or smaller nonmagical object, or a 10-foot cube of a nonmagical Huge or larger object, within 5 feet of the target, replacing it with a similar object from another version of reality. The fateholder can create or destroy the object or change its nature (for instance, adding or removing a door to a wall). This change can't immediately cause a creature or object to take damage or fall.

legendary.name: Eye Beam
entries: The fateholder uses Eye Beam.

legendary.name: Focused Eye Beam (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The fateholder uses Eye Beam. On a hit, it chooses the secondary effect instead of rolling it randomly.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The pixie has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Shadow Shroud
entries: As a bonus action, the askwise keeper can dim the lighting for 30 feet. In that area, bright light becomes dim light, and dim light becomes darkness. This ability has no effect on magical light sources.

action.name: Thorn Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 10/30 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

action.name: Oathkeeper (3/Day)
entries: The askwise keeper targets up to 4 willing creatures within 30 feet who have just spoken an oath. For a year, the first time each day that one of those creatures takes an action that breaks the oath it takes 38 ({@damage 7d10}) psychic damage. A {@spell remove curse|LevelUp}, {@spell greater restoration|LevelUp}, or {@spell wish|LevelUp} spell cast on the target using at least a 7th level slot ends this effect. The askwise keeper is always aware of the exact wording of the oath, who is currently under its effect, and can end the effect on a creature as an action.

items: The target gains truesight out to a range of 120 feet.
The target gains the benefit of the pixie's Magic Resistance trait.

action.name: Faerie Curse
entries: The pixie targets a creature within 30 feet not already under a Faerie Curse. The target makes a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is subjected to a special magical curse for 1 hour. The curse ends if the pixie dies or is {@condition incapacitated}, the pixie or one of its allies deals damage to the target, or the pixie spends an action to end the curse. Spells such as {@spell remove curse|LevelUp}, {@spell dispel magic|LevelUp}, and {@spell lesser restoration|LevelUp} also end the curse. If a creature makes its saving throw or the condition ends for it, it is immune to any Faerie Curse for the next 24 hours.
When the target fails its saving throw against this effect, the pixie chooses one of the following effects to impose on the target.

items: The target is {@condition charmed} by the pixie.
If the target is already {@condition charmed} by the pixie, the target falls asleep. It wakes if it is shaken awake as an action or if it takes damage.
The target's head takes on the appearance of a beast's head (donkey, wolf, etc.). The target's statistics don't change, but the target can no longer speak; it can only make animal noises.

bonus.name: Invisibility
entries: The pixie and any equipment it wears or carries magically turns {@condition invisible} until the pixie attacks, casts a spell, becomes {@condition incapacitated}, or uses a bonus action to become visible.

monster.name: Earless Hungerer
languages: sylvan through sign language, but can't speak

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The satyr has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Deafened
entries: An earless hungerer is permanently {@condition deafened}, has disadvantage on perception checks based on sound, and resistance to thunder damage.

trait.name: Joyless Rage
entries: The earless hungerer gains advantage on attacks against creature it has seen smiling, playing a musical instrument, or dancing, and criticals against such creatures deal an additional 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage.

action.name: Skull Smash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage. If the satyr moves at least 20 feet straight towards the target before the attack, the target makes a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or is {@condition debilitated|LevelUp} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Crippling Stomp
entries: Up to two humanoids within 5 feet of the earless hungerer make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, they take 3 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage, their movement speed is halved, and they have disadvantage on attack rolls until the beginning of the satyr's next turn.

trait.name: Acid Absorption
entries: When the sewer walker is subjected to acid damage, it instead regains hit points equal to the acid damage dealt.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shambling mound makes two lash attacks. If both attacks hit one Medium or smaller creature, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}), and the sewer walker uses Drown against it.

action.name: Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Drown
entries: The sewer walker drags a Medium or smaller {@condition grappled} creature under its body. The creature is {@condition restrained}, {@condition rattled|LevelUp}, can't breathe, and moves with the sewer walker. At the start of each of the sewer walker's turns, the target takes 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) acid damage. When the grapple ends, the creature is no longer being drowned. The sewer walker can only be drowning one creature engulfed at a time.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The huge skeletal crab makes two pincer attacks.

action.name: Pincer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) slashing damage and the target must make a {@dc 16} Strength or Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). The crab can grapple up to two creatures at once.

bonus.name: Stuffing
entries: If the crab has a Medium or smaller creature {@condition grappled}, it stuffs the creature into its shell, taking 5 points of damage itself, but trapping its target. The creature moves with the crab, but is considered {@condition restrained} (escape {@dc 16}). Every turn the creature remains {@condition restrained}, each {@creature ghoul|LevelUp} that is still inside the crab can make an attack against it with disadvantage.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: When motionless, the rock troll is indistinguishable from a typical boulder.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes thunder or cold damage, this trait doesn't function on its next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Severed Limbs
entries: If the troll is dealt a critical hit with a slashing weapon, one of its extremities is severed. The extremity has AC 15, 10 hit points, a Speed of 10, and the troll's Regeneration trait. The troll controls the severed extremity and perceives through it with the appropriate senses (for instance, it sees through the eyes of a severed head). As a bonus action, the troll can reattach the extremity. While the troll is missing the extremity, its maximum hit points are reduced by 10. Roll {@dice d6} to determine the severed extremiy:

items.name: 1-4: Arm
entries: If the troll has an arm, it loses an arm. It loses one of its claw attacks, and the severed arm can make a claw attack.

items.name: 5-6: Head
entries: If the troll has a head, it loses its head. It loses its bite attack, and the severed head can make a bite attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The troll attacks with its bite and twice with its claw.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Ambushing Shove
entries: The rock troll targets one Large or smaller creature within reach that either has not taken a turn in the combat yet, is within 5 feet of another enemy, or against whom the rock troll has advantage. The target makes a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw. On a failure, the rock troll shoves the target up to 30 feet horizontally and knocks it {@condition prone}. If the target strikes an object, such as a wall, it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target would strike another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or both take the same damage and are knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The canicore has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of its allies is within 5 feet of the creature and not {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Gliding
entries: Gliding allows the canicore to move horizontally 1 foot for every 1 foot it descends, falling if it moves less than 5 feet each turn. It can glide up to 30 feet per movement action.

trait.name: Poison Stinger
entries: A creature that takes damage from the canicore's tail must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned}. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The manticore attacks with its bite and its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage. If the manticore moves at least 20 feet straight towards the target before the attack, the target makes a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw, falling {@condition prone} on a failure.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Tail Whip
entries: If a creature the manticore can see hits it with a melee attack, the manticore attacks the attacker with its tail. If it hits, it can fly up to half its fly speed without provoking opportunity attacks from the attacker.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The aracnecore can climb even on difficult surfaces and upside down on ceilings.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The aracnecore ignores movement restrictions imposed by webs.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aracnecore makes one bite and two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target makes a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it is {@condition staggered|LevelUp} for 1 minute. The creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the stagger on a success.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d4 + 3}) slashing damage. If the manticore moves at least 20 feet straight towards the target before the attack, the target makes a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw, falling {@condition prone} on a failure.

reaction.name: Tail Whip
entries: If a creature the manticore can see hits it with a melee attack, the manticore attacks the attacker with its tail. If it hits, it can fly up to half its fly speed without provoking opportunity attacks from the attacker.

trait.name: Disconcerting Leap
entries: The blood maggot can jump up to half its Speed horizontally and half its Speed vertically. If it's within 5 feet of a creature at the end of this movement, it may make a bite attack as an action against that creature with advantage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage. The blood maggot attaches to the target. Any creature can make a {@dc 11} Strength check to remove it. While attached, the blood maggot cannot attack other creatures.

action.name: Burrow
entries: Once the blood maggot is attached, it attempts to burrow into the target, which makes a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw, taking 4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) true damage on a failure and half damage on a success.

A blood maggot can be removed with a successful piercing or slashing attack and takes damage equal to half the damage dealt to the host. If it is not removed within three rounds, the target is infected with a {@disease blood maggot infestation|LevelUp}. If the target dies at any point in this process, it rises 1 minute later as a {@creature gorger zombie|LevelUp}.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and move through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. It can't gain HP or temporary hit points.

action.name: Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing if the swarm is bloodied. Additionally, {@dice 1d4 + 1} blood maggots attach to the target (see {@creature blood maggot|LevelUp}). The swarm takes 3 damage for every blood maggot that attaches.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The corpse fly can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Putrid Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage, and the target makes a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, contracting a {@disease blood maggot infestation|LevelUp} on a failed save. On a successful save, it instead takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points from this attack it dies and rises 1 minute later as a {@creature gorger zombie|LevelUp}.

action.name: Corrosive Bile Spit (Recharge 5-6)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 15/30 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) acid damage.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The scourge can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and move through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. It can't gain HP or temporary hit points.

action.name: Putrid Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 6d6 + 4}) piercing damage or 14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) if the swarm is bloodied. The target makes a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, contracting a {@disease blood maggot infestation|LevelUp} on a failed save. On a successful save, it instead takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) if the swarm is bloodied. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points from this attack it dies and rises 1 minute later as a {@creature gorger zombie|LevelUp}.

action.name: Corrosive Bile Spit (Recharge 5-6)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 15/30 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 8d6}) acid damage.

monster.name: Gorger Zombie
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Sickening Disease
entries: If damage reduces the gorger zombie to 0 hit points, it explodes. Roll {@dice 1d4}. On a 1 to 3, this expels {@dice 2d4} {@creature blood maggot|LevelUp|blood maggots}. Each immediately makes a bite attack against a creature within 5 feet of the zombie. On a 4, a {@creature corpse fly|LevelUp} bursts out into the space the gorger zombie occupied, immediately making a putrid bite attack against a randomly-selected adjacent creature.

trait.name: Zombie Quirks
entries: All zombies have one of the following traits:

items.name: Infectious Bite
entries: A creature bitten by the zombie takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) ongoing necrotic damage until it regains hit points or a creature makes a {@dc 15} Medicine check to treat the wound. If a beast, dragon, giant, humanoid, or monstrosity dies while suffering from this effect, it becomes a zombie after 1 minute, also retaining any non-magical actions it has.

items.name: Vile Discharge
entries: The zombie's melee attacks deal an extra 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage. Additionally, when it's reduced to 0 hit points, it explodes. Creatures within 5 feet makes a Dexterity saving throw against the zombie's maneuver DC, taking 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage on a failure.

items.name: Vigor Mortis
entries: The zombie can take the Dash action as a bonus action. It can't do so again until it moves 0 feet on one of its turns.

action.name: Infested Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage. On a critical hit, instead of additional damage, a {@creature blood maggot|LevelUp} automatically attaches to the target (see {@creature blood maggot|LevelUp}) and immediately deals 4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Gorger Zombie Horde
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Area Vulnerability
entries: The horde takes double damage from any effect that targets an area.

trait.name: Horde
entries: The horde is composed of 5 or more zombies. If it is subjected to a spell, attack, or other effect that affects only one target, it takes any damage but ignores other effects. It can share its space with Medium or smaller creatures or objects. The horde can move through any opening large enough for one Medium creature without squeezing.

trait.name: Sickening Dispersal
entries: When the horde is reduced to 0 hit points, it turns into 2 ({@dice 1d4}) {@creature gorger zombie|LevelUp|gorger zombies} with 7 hit points each. Additionally, several of the fallen zombies explode, expelling their loathsome burdens. Roll {@dice 1d4}. On a 1 to 3, 1 {@creature misery of blood maggots|LevelUp} spills into an adjacent space. On a 4, 2 {@creature corpse fly|LevelUp|corpse flies} emerge and immediately make a putrid bite attack against adjacent creatures.

action.name: Infested Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 5d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. Once per day, when the gorger zombie horde rolls a critical hit, it can forgo the extra damage to instead release 1 {@creature misery of blood maggots|LevelUp} into a space adjacent to the target. The swarm can then immediately make a bite attack against any adjacent creature.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The crab can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lance crab makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). The crab has two claws and can grapple one creature with each.

action.name: Spine Barrage (2/Day)
entries: The lance crab flicks its shell upwards, sending a number of its spines arcing towards its enemy. A 5-foot-radius area within 30 feet is pelted with falling spines. Each creature in the area makes a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage on a failed save or half damage on a success. On a failure, the creature is also {@condition slowed|LevelUp} until the end of its next turn as it attempts to free itself from the spines.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hag's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Curse
entries: A creature that makes a bargain with the hag is magically cursed for 30 days. While it is cursed, the target automatically fails saving throws against the hag's {@spell scrying|LevelUp} and {@spell geas|LevelUp} spells, and the hag can cast {@spell control weather|LevelUp} centered on the creature.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The hag can breathe air and water.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Terrifying Visions
entries: The witch sends waves of visions, filling its enemies minds with images of their own death. Each creature within 30 feet that can see the hag makes a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw. A creature under the hag's curse automatically fails this saving throw. On a failure, the creature is {@condition frightened} of the hag until the end of its next turn and gains an expertise die on its next Wisdom or Dexterity saving throw, guided by the premonitions of the future. If a creature's saving throw is successful, it is immune to the hag's Terrifying Visions for 24 hours.

reaction.name: Foretelling (Recharge 5-6)
entries: When a bay witch is attacked or forced to make a saving throw it can draw on its kaleidoscope of visions to foresee the outcome. The bay witch gains advantage on its next saving throw and its AC increases by 3 until the start of its next turn.

monster.name: Assaultskull
languages: understands the language of its creator but cannot speak

trait.name: Macabre
entries: The assaultskull has advantage on Intimidation checks made against humanoids.

trait.name: Networking
entries: When the assaultskull uses its Sensor Sweep, ally mechanoskulls within 500 feet are able to see with its blindsight.

action.name: Mouthblade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Eyelaser
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 120/240 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) radiant damage.

action.name: Elemental Blast (Recharge 6)
entries: The assaultskull unleashes elemental energies in a 30-foot-long, 5-foot-wide line, choosing which when it uses this attack (acid, cold, fire, or lightning). Each creature in that area makes a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 2d8}) elemental damage on a failure or half damage on a success.

action.name: Transmit
entries: The mechanoskull sends data to an object or creature designated by its creator. As a bonus action, the designated creature can see through the mechanoskull's senses as if they were their own. A creature can only be the receiver for a number of mechanoskulls equal to its proficiency bonus and can only see through the senses of one mechanoskull at a time. During this time it is {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} to its body's surroundings. If the receiver is a computer or similar device, such as a crystal ball, the data can also be recorded for later viewing.

bonus.name: Hyperneedle (3/Day)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 200/800 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Sensor Sweep (Recharge 4-6)
entries: The assaultskull gains blindsight to a range of 60 feet until the start of its next turn.

reaction.name: Overclock
entries: The assaultskull takes the Dash action when a creature misses it with an attack.

monster.name: Decoyskull
languages: understands the language of its creator but cannot speak

trait.name: Networking
entries: When the decoyskull uses its Sensor Sweep, ally mechanoskulls within 500 feet are able to see with its blindsight.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Eyelaser
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 120/240 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) radiant damage.

action.name: Transmit
entries: The mechanoskull sends data to an object or creature designated by its creator. As a bonus action, the designated creature can see through the mechanoskull's senses as if they were their own. A creature can only be the receiver for a number of mechanoskulls equal to its proficiency bonus and can only see through the senses of one mechanoskull at a time. During this time it is {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} to its body's surroundings. If the receiver is a computer or similar device, such as a crystal ball, the data can also be recorded for later viewing.

bonus.name: Nimble Action
entries: The decoyskull takes the Dash or Disengage action.

bonus.name: Sensor Sweep (Recharge 4-6)
entries: The decoyskull gains blindsight to a range of 60 feet until the start of its next turn.

reaction.name: Self-Destruct
entries: When an attack, effect, or spell would reduce the decoyskull to 0 hit points, it moves up to 20 feet and explodes with flames in a 20-foot radius. Each creature in that area makes a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) fire damage on a failure or half damage on a success.

monster.name: Gobletskull
languages: understands the language of its creator but cannot speak

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Transmit
entries: The mechanoskull sends data to an object or creature designated by its creator. As a bonus action, the designated creature can see through the mechanoskull's senses as if they were their own. A creature can only be the receiver for a number of mechanoskulls equal to its proficiency bonus and can only see through the senses of one mechanoskull at a time. During this time it is {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} to its body's surroundings. If the receiver is a computer or similar device, such as a crystal ball, the data can also be recorded for later viewing.

bonus.name: Alcoholic Spray (2/Day)
entries: The gobletskull processes some of the wine it is carrying and sprays it as a 15-foot cone of inebriating gas. Each creature in that area makes a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it is {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. If a {@condition poisoned} creature fails the save, or if any creature fails the save by 5 or more, it falls asleep for 1 hour. It takes if it takes damage or is shaken awake as an action.

monster.name: Serviceskull
languages: understands the language of its creator but cannot speak

trait.name: Networking
entries: When the serviceskull uses its Sensor Sweep, ally mechanoskulls within 500 feet are able to see with its blindsight.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Transmit
entries: The mechanoskull sends data to an object or creature designated by its creator. As a bonus action, the designated creature can see through the mechanoskull's senses as if they were their own. A creature can only be the receiver for a number of mechanoskulls equal to its proficiency bonus and can only see through the senses of one mechanoskull at a time. During this time it is {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} to its body's surroundings. If the receiver is a computer or similar device, such as a crystal ball, the data can also be recorded for later viewing.

bonus.name: Sensor Sweep (Recharge 4-6)
entries: The serviceskull gains blindsight to a range of 60 feet until the start of its next turn.

monster.name: Spyskull
languages: understands the language of its creator but cannot speak

trait.name: Disturbing
entries: When a humanoid creature looks at the spyskull, it makes a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or becomes {@condition rattled|LevelUp} for 1 minute. A creature that fails its save by 5 or more becomes {@condition frightened} instead. On a success, the creature is immune to Disturbing for 24 hours.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Eyelaser
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120/240 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) radiant damage.

action.name: Transmit
entries: The mechanoskull sends data to an object or creature designated by its creator. As a bonus action, the designated creature can see through the mechanoskull's senses as if they were their own. A creature can only be the receiver for a number of mechanoskulls equal to its proficiency bonus and can only see through the senses of one mechanoskull at a time. During this time it is {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} to its body's surroundings. If the receiver is a computer or similar device, such as a crystal ball, the data can also be recorded for later viewing.

bonus.name: Cunning Movements
entries: The spyskull takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

bonus.name: Sensor Sweep (Recharge 4-6)
entries: The spyskull gains blindsight to a range of 60 feet until the start of its next turn.

spell.name: Template Spell

components.m: opal worth at least 1,000gp, consumed by the spell

entries.name: Target
entries: A mirror on the same plane of existence as you

entries.name: Area
entries: 10-foot cube

entries.name: Saving Throw
entries: Dexterity halves and negates deafness

A permanent, immovable zone of antimagic fills the area, suppressing all magical effects within it. At the DM's discretion, sufficiently powerful artifacts and deities may be able to ignore the zone's effects. The zone is dispelled only if more than 10 percent of its area overlaps with that of another antimagic zone spell (which is also dispelled).

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: For each slot above 6th, the aberration's AC increases by 1, its hit points increase by 10, and when it deals damage with an attack it deals {@dice 1d4} extra damage.

spell.name: Eavesdrop

entries.name: Target
entries: Once creature or object

You touch the target and mark it with a glyph that acts as a scrying sensor. The glyph is visible and resembles a one-inch-tall drawing of an ear. The sensor can be covered or concealed without changing the function of the spell. A creature can wipe it away as an action, ending the spell. You can only have one such sensor active at once.

While the sensor is active, you can use a bonus action to hear both through the sensor as though you were at its location and through your normal senses. This effect lasts until you end the spell as an action, use a bonus action to silence it (doing so does not end the spell), or the duration ends. While hearing through the sensor you have advantage on Perception checks to observe your surroundings, but not to those made to detect noises through the sensor. Additionally, you can hear through this sensor even if you are {@condition deafened}. Creatures cannot hear you through the sensor.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a 7th-level spell slot, the spell's duration increases to 30 days. When cast using a 9th-level spell slot, the spell's duration is permanent.

spell.name: Identify Weapon

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature or corpse

While casting this spell, you touch a wound on a creature or corpse. If the wound was inflicted by an object, such as a weapon, you know exactly what the specific item looks like for the purposes of spells like {@spell locate object|LevelUp}. For the duration of the spell you also know the object's general direction and its current trajectory if it's traveling.

The spell fails if the wound was inflicted by a creature's natural weapons, such as fists or claws, or by a spell. The spell also fails if the wound was inflicted more than 3 days ago. If the weapon is more than 5 miles away, has been destroyed, or if there is any thickness of lead in the direct path between you and the object, the spell is unable to provide its direction.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a 3rd-level spell slot, the spell's duration increases to 10 minutes and it can detect a weapon up to 30 miles away.

spell.name: Reopen Rift
entries: If any creature used teleportation or plane shift magic, such as {@spell dimension door|LevelUp} or {@spell teleportation circle|LevelUp}, to leave the spell's area within the past 24 hour, a glowing rift appears in the space from which they left. If multiple spells have been cast within this period, only the most recent rift materialises.

A rift resembles a glowing, opaque circle of light through which its destination can't be seen. The rift remains open until the end of your next turn. During this item, any creature can pass through the rift. When they enter the rift, they are teleported to the destination of the original teleportation effect that was used to leave the area. If the destination is currently occupied, the creature takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) force damage and appears in the closes unoccupied space to the destination. Creature that enter the rift cannot use it to return, though as long as it is within 24 hours of the target spell's casting you can choose to cast this spell a second time to reopen your last rift instead of opening a new one, regardless of what other teleportation effects have been used in the area in the meantime.

spell.name: Silver Shield

components.m: 20 silver coins, which are consumed by the spell

entries.name: Target
entries: One nonmagical shield
You touch a nonmagical shield, giving it a silver mirror coating (see Adventurer's Guide pg324).

While a creature wields this silver shield, its face is fully concealed by an illusory silver visor that resembles a blank, featureless face. This grants the wearer advantage on Intimidation checks against its own creature tyep, as well as a {@dice 1d6} expertise die to saving throws made to resist being {@condition charmed}, {@condition debilitated|LevelUp}, or {@condition rattled|LevelUp}. This visor does not impair the creature's vision and can't be removed except by removing the shield. Additionally, while wearing the shield the creature's voice becomes metallic and unrecognisable. Creatures have disadvantage on checks made to identify a creature wielding the shield.

spell.name: Stone Sentinel

components.m: book of laws written in silver ink worth 1,000 gp, which is consumed by the spell

entries.name: Target
entries: One nonmagical Medium or Large statue

You touch a statue and transform it into a {@creature walking statue|LevelUp}. The walking statue is either Medium or Large, depending on the original statue's size, and its Intelligence is 8 (-1); otherwise, its statistics are unchanged.

This stone sentinel is not under your control. Instead, it remains dormant in its original position. It is indistinguishable from a normal statue until it perceives a law being broken, at which point it takes action. The walking statue is aware of all laws in the book used as the material component, though its understanding of the law is literal and without nuance. You can update the laws for a stone sentinel you have created with another casting of this spell, using the new law book as the material component.
Each time you cast the spell, you can choose between three sets of instructions, which the walking statuse will carry out to the best of its ability.

items.name: 1. Apprehend Criminals
entries: When the sentinel perceives a major or minor law being broken, it chases the lawbreaker and attacks them. If it loses sight of a lawbreaker or if the lawbreaker is reduced to 0 hit points, the sentinel returns to its original position and returns to its dormant state. The stone statue's attacks are non-lethal.

items.name: 2. Apprehend Criminals with Extremem Prejudice
entries: As Apprehend Criminals, but the stone sentinel's attacks are not non-lethal.

items.name: 3. Keep Watch
entries: When the stone sentinel perceives a crime, it does not move or attack. Instead, it sounds the alarm, shouting the nature of the crime, as well as the direction and description of the lawbreaker. It continues to shout the crime and the last known direction and description for 5 rounds.

spell.name: Trace Magic Aura

entries.name: Target
entries: Self

Until the spell ends you sense the lingering aura of spells that were cast within the recent past. For you to detect a spell's aura, it must have been cast within the radius of this spell and in a location you can see. You can pinpoint the location where the spellcaster stood at the time that they cast the spell, the spell's schools of magic, and its area of effect (if it is completely within this spell's radius). If the spell is one that you know, you can identify it as such.

A spell's magic aura can be traced for one hour per level of the spell slot used to cast it. For instance, {@spell fireball|LevelUp} cast with a 4th-level slot can be detected with trace magic aura for 4 hours after it is cast.

{@spell arcanist’s magic aura|LevelUp} can erase a spell's lingering aura or manufacture a false one. Furthermore, trace magic aura doesn't detect castings of {@spell arcanist’s magic aura|LevelUp} or {@spell nondetection|LevelUp}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a 3rd-level or higher spell slot, you can detect castings of {@spell arcanist’s magic aura|LevelUp} or {@spell nondetection|LevelUp} as long as you cast this spell with a higher-level spell slot than was used to cast {@spell arcanist’s magic aura|LevelUp} or {@spell nondetection|LevelUp}.
